ISKORLY TUTORIAL
 
 Welcome to Iskorly - your AI-powered answer sheet scanner and scorer.
 
 ━━━ BEFORE YOU START ━━━
 
 First, you need:
 • Student Name - Enter the student's full name
 • Subgroup 1 (Section) - e.g., "Grade 7-A" or "Section Mango"
 • Subgroup 2 (Exam) - e.g., "Math Quiz 1" or "Midterm Exam"
 • Answer Key - Set up your correct answers (see Setup below)
 
 ━━━ SCANNING FLOW ━━━
 
 Step 1: TAP START SCAN
 - Camera opens and waits for you to capture the answer sheet
 - OR tap Import Photos to select multiple images from gallery
 
 Step 2: TAKE PHOTO
 - Position the answer sheet in good lighting
 - Keep it flat and fill the frame
 - Tap the Scan button to capture
 
 Step 3: CROP THE IMAGE
 - The cropper opens automatically after capture
 - Drag corners to focus on the answer area only
 - Use rotate buttons if sheet is sideways
 - Tap checkmark to confirm crop
 
 Step 4: OCR PARSES ANSWERS
 - App extracts text and matches to your answer key
 - Only questions in your key are shown
 - Results appear in a 2-column editable grid
 
 Step 5: EDIT ANSWERS (if needed)
 - Tap any cell to manually correct OCR errors
 - Green = Correct, Red = Wrong, Yellow = Blank
 
 Step 6: CONFIRM SCORE
 - Tap "Confirm & Score" to calculate results
 - Score is displayed immediately
 
 Step 7: SAVE TO HISTORY
 - Tap Save to store the record
 - Tap Scan Again to process another sheet
 
 ━━━ CROPPING TIPS ━━━
 
 • Free-Style Crop - Drag any corner to custom size
 • Rotate - Use left/right buttons for 90° turns
 • Aspect Ratio - Choose Free, 4:3, or 1:1 presets
 • Source Aspect - Keeps original photo proportions
 • Tip: Crop tightly around answers for best OCR accuracy
 
 ━━━ SETTINGS ━━━
 
 Access from menu → Settings:
 
 • Two-Column OCR
 What: Splits image into left/right halves for processing
 When: Use for 1-60 two-column answer forms
 Note: Improves accuracy on multi-column layouts
 
 • High-Contrast OCR
 What: Applies adaptive thresholding to image
 When: Use for faint handwriting or light pencil marks
 Note: May reduce quality on clear printed text
 
 • Large Text Mode
 What: Increases font size and button touch targets
 When: Use for better readability (recommended for accessibility)
 Note: Makes UI easier to read and interact with
 
 ━━━ SETUP ANSWER KEY ━━━
 
 From menu → Setup:
 
 • Slots - Create different keys for different quizzes
 - New: Add a new answer key slot
 - Rename: Change slot name
 - Delete: Remove unused slots
 - Import/Export: Share keys between devices
 
 • Add Answers
 - Enter Question # (e.g., 1, 2, 3...)
 - Enter Answer (A-Z letter or text up to 40 chars)
 - Tap Save to add to key
 
 • Remove - Enter question # to delete from key
 • Clear All - Delete entire answer key (use with caution)
 
 ━━━ MASTERLIST & HISTORY ━━━
 
 VIEW HISTORY:
 • Shows all saved records organized by Exam and Section
 • Tap to expand/collapse groups
 • Tap record to view details, rename, or delete
 • Filter by Exam or Section using dropdowns
 
 MASTERLIST (Item Analysis):
 • Aggregates per-question statistics across all records
 • Shows: Question # | Correct | Incorrect | % | Common Miss
 • Identifies difficult questions and common mistakes
 • Use for test improvement and item analysis
 
 EXPORT CSV:
 • From History, tap menu → Export CSV
 • Choose "Entire History" or "Current Filters"
 • File saved to Downloads folder
 • Open with Excel, Sheets, or any spreadsheet app
 
 ━━━ TROUBLESHOOTING ━━━
 
 Camera Not Ready:
 - Wait a moment for camera to initialize
 - Check camera permissions in device settings
 - Restart app if camera doesn't open
 
 Crop Canceled:
 - If you tap X or back, crop is canceled
 - App falls back to original uncropped image
 - You can still proceed with OCR
 
 No Answers Parsed:
 - Check lighting - avoid shadows and glare
 - Ensure answer sheet is flat and in focus
 - Try cropping tighter around answer area
 - For handwriting: use dark pen, write clearly
 - Enable High-Contrast OCR in Settings for faint marks
 - Verify answer key is set up correctly
 
 OCR Returns Wrong Answers:
 - Manually edit in the answer grid before scoring
 - Try re-scanning with better lighting
 - Crop to exclude non-answer areas
 - Check if Two-Column OCR setting helps (for 2-column forms)
 
 ━━━ BEST PRACTICES ━━━
 
 Photography:
 • Good, even lighting (no shadows or glare)
 • Keep answer sheet flat and parallel to camera
 • Fill frame but leave small margins
 • Use in-app crop to focus on answers only
 
 Handwritten Answers:
 • Use dark pen (black or blue, not light colors)
 • Write clearly in designated boxes/areas
 • Avoid cross-outs when possible
 • Crop tightly around answers for best results
 
 Batch Scanning:
 • Use Import Photos to select multiple images
 • Keep consistent lighting across all sheets
 • Same orientation for all images
 • Review merged results carefully
 • First non-blank answer wins in conflicts
 
 That's it! Tap OK to start using Iskorly.
